meanings.definition: To attach a clitic to a word.
meanings.sent1: She will cliticize the pronoun onto the verb.
meanings.sent2: It is common in some languages to cliticize pronouns to verbs.
meanings.sent3: The language teacher joked that she could cliticize a smiley face to the end of every sentence.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was so strong that it seemed to cliticize itself to every word he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The idea of cliticizing a tiny flag to each word to show its origin amused the students.

meanings.sent1: They cliticize easily in this language.
meanings.sent2: In linguistics, some words naturally cliticize to form new structures.
meanings.sent3: The children found it funny to try and cliticize their names together to create a new word.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to cliticize into a jumble of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes seemed to cliticize into a beautiful masterpiece before our eyes.

meanings.definition: To use a clitic in speech.
meanings.sent1: He will cliticize it for emphasis.
meanings.sent2: When speaking quickly, people tend to cliticize more.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's routine involved trying to cliticize as many words as possible in a sentence.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions cliticized into her words, making them more powerful.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice seemed to cliticize with the music, creating a mesmerizing performance.
